column1: Checklist for Artic Field Sequencing Kit  (x100 Seq Samples)

column10: Large scale haulage, with the option of both wheels and back-packing for the harder terrain. Going to be pretty heavy when full.
Rationale

Vilo provides the fastest and most robust means of cDNA synthesis for viruses, and would work perfectly well for other pathogens as well. Proven effective in the ebola outbreak, and also in subsequent sequencing of HIV and norovirus on low yield samples
Back-up reagent which should provide broader specifications in the event that the pathogen is unknown, and also in the event that the vilo fails, this provides redundancy. Optional.
Primary amplification of unknown pathogens in the event that vilo doesn't work.
Amplification and pull-down of viruses in the event that other methods fail. Optional.

Kod has been providing ample length reads and accuracy for sample preparation, is rapid, and significantly more cost-effective than alternatives. Comes in 2 formats, 2x mastermix would be optimal for space, but 1000x reagent provides more samples.
Individual primers, in the event that more than 100x samples need to be used, then it is optional to bring the unpooled primers in the kit.

Primers ordered from Eurofins, diluted to 100mM each, then pooled into a single 10x reaction volume, to allow easier transport than carrying the individual primers. Be cautious with dilution calculations.

Primers ordered from Eurofins, diluted to 100mM each, then pooled into a single 10x reaction volume, to allow easier transport than carrying the individual primers. Be cautious with dilution calculations.

Qubit 4 provides the greatest breadth of sample recognition and the best accuracy for NGS with nanopore. The NGS starter kit would be optimal, providing DNA HS Kit and tubes for 500 reactions. Optional addition of RNA 1x HS kit for primary sample quants.
As described in "Quick" protocol (Nature, 2017) provides the most rapid library preparation for native barcoding.
Optional addition if the samples are of indeterminate age or quality, or isolated from difficult tissues.

Most expensive part of the kit, consisting of 12 R9.5 flowcells, 4 kits (to choice, but recommend LSK108 for ease of use, or rapid kits in the event of maximal speed requirement. If rapid kits are taken, suggest taking native kits as a backup.)

Replacement for AmpureXP beads, no discernible difference in performance, and approximately half the price. For purification and size selection of amplicon products, follow same protocol outlined in "Quick" paper.
Inactivation of RNAse prior to library preparation in Hood1 is recommended, along with decontamination of pipettes during use.
Reduction of DNA contamination prior to commencing protocol. Keep it away from the samples though.
Prior to use and post-use of both hoods, recommend 30-60 mins of UV treatment of surfaces and equipment to prevent contamination.
Backtie lab gowns get in the way less than front button, but either would work.
Recommend taking 2 of these hoods, to prevent cross contamination, one for PCR mastermixing and one for sample prep. Also recommend replacing metal frame with uPVC
See above.

Rubber bench mats for working both in the hoods and outside, can be chemically treated or UV-treated without degradation, and prevents the need for paper towelling or bench-coat transport. Rolls to 1inch bundle, so not space consuming.
Pathogen inactivation, so potentially not required for sequencing run only.
Takes approximately 8x1mL tips per single sample preparation, so recommend 20% redundancy. Suggest taking 1-2 boxes of tips plus bagged backups to save space.
Takes approximately 18x100uL tips per single sample prep. Suggest taking 1-2 boxes of tips plus bagged backups to save space.
Takes approximately 17x10uL tips per single sample prep. Suggest taking 1-2 boxes of tips plus bagged backups to save space.
Including PCR, takes 4 tubes per single sample prep
For cleanups. Takes 4 tubes per single sample prep, plus 3 tubes for mastermixing
Individual PCR backups and mastermix prep, takes 4 tubes per sample.
Takes 3 tubes per sample, plus 2 tubes per run for controls and calibration.
Each box takes approximately 15 samples worth of tips.
Don't leave home without them.
Each sample set takes 4 pairs of gloves, 2 for each hood.
If you have dainty hands.
Roll of paper towelling, always the most reliable way of cleaning stuff.
Simplest means of 8-strip amplifications and also a good heat-block source. Runs on minimal power, and compact.
qPCR, PCR and heatblock in one, does 16 samples per reaction, compact, approximately the size of 2xMiniPCR
Still the best magnetic rack, though it's expensive. Does 16 samples per cleanup, magnet is better than most I have tried.
96 well alternative for use with large scale preparations. Would have to include 96 well plates, which is fine, could replace strip tubes with PCR plates in a pinch.
See earlier.
See earlier.
See earlier.
Recommend Finnipette F2 pipettes, seem more robust than the Gilson's, and lighter with less things to fall off.
Optional, but would recommend taking multichannels to protect user's mental health.
Optional, but would recommend taking multichannels to protect user's mental health.

Recommend taking a bobble, it's all you need for the protocols of sequencing. For sample prep, need a better solution. Take 2x attachments, both a circular rotor and a strip rotor. One plus one for redundancy.
One plus one for redundancy.
Collapsible racks, for space saving, also takes all tube sizes apart from strip tubes.
USB charging lights for inside the hoods.
Soak in water and freeze prior to departure, store in the cold-box storage. Re-freeze whenever possible.
Ideal for keeping things cool without taking too much space. Optional though.
12V cold-bag, collapsible and insulated, maintains temp 15-20 below ambient, when paired with ice blocks should provide days of cold.
Optional redundancy for failure of PCR machines.
Pre-freeze and store in the cold box, for use with strip tubes.
Solar generator, provides 12-24 hours battery life when used in conjunction with solar charging. Primary power source.
17h to charge Yeti from empty, but ideally would use to seep-charge constantly.

column1: APC mini UPS (APC Back-UPS ES 700 - Uninterruptible Power Supply 700VA, BE700G-UK, 8 Outlets, Surge protected
column10: Provides surge protection and also battery UPS redundancy for 8 hours. 4 ports for surge only, 4 ports for battery UPS.
For use with multiple inputs.
Large scale storage solution, secondary backup, recommend 2 for redundancy.
Primary storage solution, faster data processing.
Need a PC compatible machine, recommend getting either a PC or a linux box, because it's useless and slow with Parallels.
Note taking and protocol carrying. Not essential, and recommend paper backups of the protocols and sample lists.
Recommend taking something for printing on the tubes, because handwriting is a pain.
